Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Nipple-Sparing Mastectomy Techniques with Immediate Prosthetic Breast Reconstruction

Trial_Design.evidence: The study included 1525 patients: 504 in the RNSM group, 771 in the CNSM group, and 250 in the ENSM group.

Intervention.evidence: robotic (RNSM), conventional (CNSM), and endoscope-assisted nipple-sparing mastectomy (ENSM) combined with immediate prosthetic breast reconstruction (IPBR)

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the relative efficacy of robotic (RNSM), conventional (CNSM), and endoscope-assisted nipple-sparing mastectomy (ENSM) combined with immediate prosthetic breast reconstruction (IPBR) for breast cancer treatment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was incision length, measured immediately post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study included 1525 patients: 504 in the RNSM group, 771 in the CNSM group, and 250 in the ENSM group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ENSM with IPBR resulted in a significantly smaller incision (WMD: -5.57 cm, 95% CI: -10.74 to -0.69) compared to CNSM.
